programme.title: NFL Game Re-Airs
programme.desc: Bryce Young breaks the Panthers franchise record for passing yards in a game as Carolina rallies from a 14-point deficit in an overtime thriller against the Atlanta Falcons.

programme.title: NFL Game Re-Airs
programme.desc: Houston Texans quarterback C.J. Stroud threw a touchdown pass, Derek Stingley returned an interception for a score and the Texans beat the Las Vegas Raiders 23-21 for their seventh straight victory and the Raiders' ninth loss in a row.

programme.title: NFL Game Re-Airs
programme.desc: Tony Pollard rushed for a career-high 161 yards and two touchdowns as Tennessee averaged 5.3 yards per carry. The defense forced a pair of turnovers in the second half and the special teams blocked a punt.

programme.title: NFL Game Re-Airs
programme.desc: The Broncos complete one of the wildest comebacks in NFL history, scoring 33-points in the fourth quarter to rally from a 19-0 Giants' lead in a crazy game between the Jaxson Dart led Giants and the Bo Nix led Broncos.

programme.title: NFL Throwback
programme.desc: See which players had speed one simply couldn't teach, separating themselves as the greatest athletes in NFL history.

programme.title: NFL Game Re-Airs
programme.desc: Jalen Hurts lets it fly as A.J. Brown and DeVonta Smith combine for 304 yards and 3 touchdowns as the Eagles outscore a Carson Wentz led Vikings team 28-22.

programme.title: NFL Game Re-Airs
programme.desc: Drake Maye threw 3 second-half touchdown passes to help the Patriots overcome defensive end Myles Garrett's 5 sacks, erase an early deficit, and roll to their fifth straight victory over the Cleveland Browns on Sunday.

programme.title: NFL Game Re-Airs
programme.desc: Baltimore Ravens running back Derrick Henry rushed for a season-high 216 yards - the most ever by a visiting player at Lambeau Field - and matched a career high with 4 touchdown runs in the Ravens' 41-24 victory over the Green Bay Packers.

programme.title: NFL Game Re-Airs
programme.desc: Joe Flacco passed for 342 yards and three touchdowns as he rallied Cincinnati to a 33-31 victory over the Pittsburgh Steelers as the third time during the regular season where both starting quarterbacks are in their 40s.

programme.title: NFL Game Re-Airs
programme.desc: Sam Darnold guides a 16-point comeback against the Rams to force ot. Jaxson Smith Njigba's touchdown and tight end Eric Saubert's two-point conversion complete the Seattle Seahawks comeback win in overtime with a 38-37 win over the Los Angeles Rams.

programme.title: NFL Game Re-Airs
programme.desc: Jonathan Taylor got his career high in scrimmage yards with 286, fifth game with three or more toouchdowns this season as Indianapolis wins in overtime at Olympiastadion Berlin 31-25 over Atlanta.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: When Mark tries to play Cupid between Lucas and a pretty young stranger who arrives in North Fork, the girl's two older brothers accuse him of trifling with her affections and challenge him to fight them both.

programme.title: Yancy Derringer
programme.desc: Yancy investigates counterfeit money that's being passed throughout the French Quarter. His investigation brings him into contact with Lonesome Jackson, a miner who recently struck in rich & seeking a wife. The Treasury Department suspects Jackson because of the large bankroll he's carrying, but Yancy believes that the miner is being set up as a patsy by the real counterfeiters.

programme.title: Yancy Derringer
programme.desc: Yancy assists in transporting a Presidential pardon intended to save a Southerner who sided with the Union army from an unjust death sentence. However, his delivery is derailed by army officer with vengeance in his heart who attempts to carry out the execution anyway. Now Yancy must find a way to ease the last vestiges of the Civil War before someone dies!

programme.title: Bat Masterson
programme.desc: Bat presides over a shooting contest and must confront a bully who cheats his way to first place.

programme.title: Bat Masterson
programme.desc: Bat must convince the owners of a dangerous Colorado mine to halt work before an accident occurs.

programme.title: The Lone Ranger
programme.desc: An adopted boy mistakenly believes that his outlaw father is a hero.

programme.title: The Lone Ranger
programme.desc: As a prospector, the Lone Ranger seeks a criminal mastermind.

programme.title: The Lone Ranger
programme.desc: It's a race against time to recover money stolen in a bank robbery.

programme.title: The Lone Ranger
programme.desc: A geologist is badly beaten when he uncovers land fraud.

programme.title: North to Alaska
programme.desc: When George Pratt (Stewart Granger) and Sam McCord (John Wayne) strike gold in Alaska, they must struggle to keep their fortune because of the constant interference from Frankie Canon (Ernie Kovacs), who wants to claim the gold for himself. After being ordered to find George's fianc√©e in Seattle, Sam discovers that she has already married another man. Unable to deliver George's fianc√©e, Sam decides to bring him a prostitute named Angel (Capucine).

programme.title: True Grit
programme.desc: After hired hand Tom Chaney (Jeff Corey) murders the father of 14-year-old Mattie Ross (Kim Darby), she seeks vengeance and hires U.S. Marshal Rooster Cogburn (John Wayne), a man of true grit, to track Chaney into Indian territory. As the two begin their pursuit, a Texas Ranger, La Boeuf (Glen Campbell), joins the manhunt in hopes of capturing Chaney for the murder of a Texas senator and collecting a substantial reward. The three clash on their quest of bringing to justice the same man.

programme.title: Return of the Frontiersman
programme.desc: A sheriff (Jack Holt) leads a posse to capture his son (Gordon MacRae), who has been framed for bank robbery.

programme.title: The Roy Rogers Show
programme.desc: A shooting occurs when an outlaw gang tries to kidnap the governor.

programme.title: The Roy Rogers Show
programme.desc: A pair of hired gunmen ambush a friend of Roy's friends on the Double-R Bar.

programme.title: The Roy Rogers Show
programme.desc: A tyrannical Boston financier travels to Mineral City to confront his son.

programme.title: The Roy Rogers Show
programme.desc: A young man has been wrongly accused of murdering his fianc√©'s father

programme.desc: Hoppy frightens an outlaw gang by writing in prominent places the code numbers 3-7-77, the symbol of a band of vigilante terrorists.

programme.title: Hopalong Cassidy
programme.desc: Hoppy tries to trick an elderly woman's kidnappers by inducing Red Connors to wear her clothes.

programme.title: Hopalong Cassidy
programme.desc: Hoppy and Red arrest a young man whom they find wounded near the body of his uncle, but they soon learn that he's suffering from amnesia and try to clear him.

programme.title: Hopalong Cassidy
programme.desc: When a Mexican rancher accuses an innocent man of murder, Hoppy uses a black sombrero to clear the frame-up victim and save a wealthy young heiress.

programme.title: The Californians
programme.desc: The Bandanna Gang is causing a disturbance, so Matt consents to escort some settlers to San Francisco.

programme.title: The Californians
programme.desc: Marshal Wayne suspects fraud when a couple start selling stock in a gold mine.

programme.title: The Lonesome Trail
programme.desc: A group of conniving land-grabbers is deterred from further evil by a Western Robin Hood armed with a bow and arrow.

programme.title: The Californians
programme.desc: Matt gets sworn in as a U.S. marshal when stage holdups occur.

programme.title: The Californians
programme.desc: The Prince of Thieves executes a daring robbery in San Francisco.

programme.title: The Californians
programme.desc: Matt goes sinister Hangtown due to a dying man's last request.

programme.title: The Californians
programme.desc: A gang of thieves tries to frame Corey Harris.

programme.title: Tombstone Territory
programme.desc: Gambler Raoul de Moreney is accused of card cheating at the saloon; Harris Claibourne is challenged to a duel after discovering the cheater is a well known hustler who has killed numerous men.

programme.title: Tombstone Territory
programme.desc: While arresting two gunmen at the saloon, Jake Hoyt saves Hollister from being shot in the back by a third gunman; Hoyt has an ulterior motive for saving Hollister's life.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: An arch-criminal has been run out of New Orleans and is passing through North Fork. Spotting the McCain ranch, he tells McCain he wants to buy it.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: Young Dan Willard takes on Marshal Micah Torrence's job. With no experience, he takes a tough stand with a bunch of Texas cowhands whose high spirits are evident at the saloon.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: Lucas gets in trouble when he accuses the foreman of a neighboring ranch of rustling some of his cattle.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: Lucas and Mark are returning from a big cattle sale when the stage is robbed by three outlaws. Lucas, desperate to recover the money that was stolen, is determined to pursue the outlaws.

programme.title: Yancy Derringer
programme.desc: Yancy investigates when several shopkeepers along Duquense Street pay twice as much for what their property is worth, & are subsequently robbed & murdered. He learns that a projected railroad spur is to be built to the waterfront through that shopping district and unscrupulous Northerners plan to use illegal means to grab all the available real estate before the project is officially announced.

programme.title: Yancy Derringer
programme.desc: Derringer is falsely accused of complicity in a waterfront property theft. Administer Colton manages to get Matthew Younger to drop the charges, but Yancy discovers the accuser may be throwing charges around to conceal the real perpetrators. His investigations lead him to a waterfront dive and its grave-robbing habitu√©s.

programme.title: Bat Masterson
programme.desc: An Englishman decides to test his customized pistol on Bat.

programme.title: Bat Masterson
programme.desc: Bat ejects a business partner from a casino after he catches the man embezzling money, but instead of deterring the crook, Bat only provokes his ire.

programme.title: The Texan
programme.desc: Bill comes to the defense of an unassuming man who is being bullied and tries to encourage him to stand up for himself. Soon the man asks Bill to teach him how to use a gun.

programme.title: The Texan
programme.desc: Bill takes the job of escorting a convicted killer to his hanging, knowing that the man's sons and gang members are in the area planning to free him.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: Lucas and Mark try to persuade a persecuted young mute to return stolen money.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: A lively old lady arrives in town hot on the trail of a notorious bandit and the reward money for capturing him.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: A doctor seeks revenge on the man he blames for ruining his practice.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: Lucas and Marshall Torrance run into trouble while transporting a captured killer back to face trial.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: A deathbed request from an old friend sends Lucas to a neighboring town in search of the man's long-lost sweetheart.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: Lucas thinks he has seen a ghost when a young man, eerily similar to a man he killed in the Civil War, challenges him to a gunfight.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: Lucas agrees to take a job as an undercover agent and goes to investigate rumors of the sales of arms to renegade Indians. His life is endangered by the town drunk who stumbles onto his true identity.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: Lucas looks for answers when recovering alcoholic Micah Torrence returns to the bottle and turns in his badge.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: In a ghost town, Lucas, Mark and Micah tangle with the Newman family and learn the secret of the town's 20-year-old mystery of a lost gold mine.

programme.title: The Rifleman

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: A deranged ex-prisoner of war, cruelly abused in a Northern army prison, captures Lucas, locks him in a cage and vows to make him suffer for his part in the Civil War.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: Lucas is threatened with hanging by a lynch party when some horses he has purchased in a neighboring town turn out to be stolen.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: A janitor-turned-gunfighter's reputation hangs on one lucky shot and a lot of gall. The handyman finds himself in trouble when he accidentally kills another gunfighter.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: Lucas tries to get help when he is shot after witnessing a murder.

programme.title: The Rifleman

programme.desc: Two pranksters write away for a mail-order bride, using Lucas's name.

programme.desc: Lucas recognizes Dr. Battle as an ex-gunslinger with whom he once fought. He helps with a dying man, but Lucas and the doctor have unresolved anger.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: Josh is hired by Harry Weaver to track down his twin brother Pete, a wanted man. Harry is tired of being used by Pete, plus the law and bounty hunters are apt to mistake him for Pete.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: Josh is called in to track down a new outlaw, the local sheriff who is a friend. The good sheriff who was seduced into robbing a bank by his girlfriend, convinces Josh to let him assist in her capture

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: Josh takes a job protecting a deaf teenage girl and keeping everyone off the father's place for a day or two. Although initially bored, Josh starts to develop a relationship with the friendly girl.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: Josh escorts a photographer to take a picture of his friend El Gato, who is a hilarious bandit living in the hills of Mexico with a small army. However, El Gato is new to photographs and leery.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: A broke Josh is hired by a fearful man to help him elope with his sweetheart, Jane, the daughter of a local rancher. The girl's father is vehemently opposed to the marriage.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: Josh takes a job protecting an express office employee who stole $10,000 and wants to return it before it's discovered missing. However, he had an accomplice and does not know where the accomplice is.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: A Japanese woman travels to the U.S. to find a man who proposed to her and hires Josh to find him since no one will help her. Josh is confronted by the Japanese man to whom she had been promised.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: Josh arrives in town thinking the sheriff summoned him to go after a man. Instead, a woman wants Josh to bring in the man, her wanted husband, alive, so he can prove self defense.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: Josh rides to Barney Durant's horse business right after Barney pushes his son to leave. When Josh's prisoners escape taking 2 horses from his horse trader friend, he helps in tracking them down.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: Josh is summoned for help when the Pinto bank is robbed.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: Josh expects a bounty for bringing in Daniel Trenner but his prisoner is stolen by the sheriff. Ex-army personnel want to stage an illegal trial accusing their former lieutenant of dereliction of duty

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: Josh is hired by a woman to sober up Harry, a drunk who is also Josh's friend. She learned his wealthy brother who Harry hasn't seen in years is coming to visit so she wants Harry to be presentable.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: Josh and the beautiful prisoner he is transporting are on a three day trip while her partner is still on the loose. For once Josh may not follow through on obeying the law as they fall in love.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: Josh is on his way to River City to transport three convicts there to be hanged. The dangerous prisoners escape and appoint themselves the law, after the town is hit by a tornado, killing the sheriff.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: A journalist accompanies Josh on his manhunt to get an exclusive story on a bounty hunter. Josh agrees to let him join him in the hunt for Jack Torrance but finds they have different methods.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: Josh feels compelled to repay a debt to an old friend who's in jail and may hang. However, the friend escapes, forcing Josh to go on the hunt for him until it appears he died when he went over a cliff

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: Josh brings in outlaw Carlos Domingo, but he has to be released when the witness against him is killed. Josh concocts a surprise witness to testify against the notorious killer - his own mother.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: Josh is sent for by the desperate men of Coronado. He is hired to convince the women of the town to come back to their men when they leave demanding that all towns men give up their guns for good.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: Josh brings in a man wanted for robbery but loses his reward. A well meaning doctor pays an innocent man to take the blame for his son, but the son sets out to kill the man to make sure he never tells

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: Josh arrives in a town for rest just as the local bank has been robbed. A traveling medicine man knows the whereabouts of the suspect and wants Josh to help because he thinks the suspect is innocent.

programme.desc: A widow wants to hire/propose to Josh so she doesn't lose custody of her son. Josh served under her husband in the war. His mother now is trying to steal her grandson to take over the family fortune.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: When Dr. G receives Lea Conrad's body, she suspects the woman may have died from an antihistamine overdose. Then, Dr. G learns that Lea was being treated for lupus.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: Paramedics respond to a mother in distress: one of her infant twin girls hasn't woken up. By the time help arrives, it's too late. But there is no apparent cause of death.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: 58-year-old Leroy Williams is rushed to the ER by his wife after becoming disorientated. Doctors work tirelessly, but Leroy slips into a coma and eventually dies.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: Two patients arrive at the ER with bizarre fishing injuries; a martial arts instructor suffers abdominal pains; teenage victims of a car crash fill a small ER.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: A man dressed as Santa is near death and his wife asks to harvest his semen.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: On Christmas Eve, a burn victim receives a rare treatment the doctors have never performed before.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: A young woman is rushed to the ER after being bitten on the face by a dog.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: A woman's face-lift goes wrong, a hospital chaplain's sudden personality change baffles the ER staff and more.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: Celebrations morph into medical mania after their special occasions land them in the ER.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: An unconscious woman is bleeding internally. A man with a 4-day erection needs extraordinary help.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: A woman risks losing her finger after trying on an engagement ring, a body builder can't breathe and more.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: An urgent care physician must invent creative ways to save a choking child.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: A violent patient faking a coma holds doctors and police hostage after stealing a policeman's gun.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: An ER doctor gets his patient drunk to save his life as a guilty family member looks on.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: A mugging victim arrives with two bullet wounds to the brain.

programme.desc: When a man with a hand injury passes out from abdominal pain, tests lead to a shocking discovery.

programme.desc: A young boy at a sleepover party mysteriously loses control of his arms and legs.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: An unconscious woman is bleeding internally. A man with a 4-day erection needs extraordinary help.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: A grown man screams incessantly, a young mother is ice cold and a boy denies overdosing on drugs.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: A bride can't go through with her wedding because she feels possessed by creatures crawling in her head.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: A patient comes in with progressing paralysis, a boy is crushed by an ATV and more.

programme.desc: An ER nurse brings her delirious husband to the ER, then notices that his breath smells like mothballs.

programme.title: Baggage
programme.desc: Contestants on this dating game show don't want to hear the elimination line "I'm sorry, but you have too much baggage." How much is acceptable among three contestants in each episode is determined by the "dater," who hears the candidates' intimate secrets and hidden flaws, as well as their attempts to deflect these traits by describing their positive attributes. After two elimination rounds leave one remaining contestant, it's the dater's turn to reveal his or her own baggage ... and then the contestant decides to go forward with the date or not. Jerry Springer hosts.

programme.title: Monty Don's American Gardens
programme.desc: Monty explores the extraordinary scenery of the west coast of America. He begins his journey in Arizona where he learns about cacti and marvels at the sight of them in the desert and in private gardens where they have replaced traditional plants and lawns.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty welcomes spring at Longmeadow with plenty of changes in the garden to share. As well as getting on with some essential pruning, he lifts and divides perennials, starts sowing chillies and begins growing this year's vegetables.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty tackles three seasons of gardening when he makes additions to his spring garden, gives advice on how to dry and preserve herbs for winter and plants up a container to give interest from now until spring. Carol celebrates one of the plant successes of an extraordinary summer, the Canna while Frances Tophill tackles a viewer's garden and suggests plants which will perform throughout the winter. Toby Buckland visits a garden in Devon with Japanese influences.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty has tips and ideas for planting up garden pots to provide a focal point over the winter months, Rachel visits the tulips of Keukenhof, Joe visits Esther Rantzen's much-loved garden, and Carol visits Glebe Cottage.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As well as looking at the changes to his garden that have taken place over winter, Monty Don reveals how to plant bare-rooted raspberries in his renovated fruit garden and gets his secateurs out to rejuvenate an overgrown winter flowering honeysuckle. Plus, Monty recommends jobs for the weekend to ensure that all our seeds, seedlings and plants get off to the best possible start.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don is planting out his tender annual plants into a container for colour and interest all summer long. He is also busy in the vegetable garden with tips and advice on how best to grow cauliflowers and protect them so that you get to eat them before the birds and caterpillars do. Meanwhile, Carol Klein answers an unusual dilemma from a gardener who lives in a lighthouse.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: With the garden springing into life and new blooms opening each day, it gives Monty Don plenty of opportunity to get on top of all the seasonal jobs at Longmeadow. With a postbag full of gardening dilemmas, Carol Klein helps out one viewer with propagation queries. There's also a look behind the scenes with Rachel de Thame as she races to get the Royal barge planted up for the Thames Diamond Jubilee Pageant.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: It is the summer solstice so the days are the longest of the year and the sun is at its highest. With the garden growing before our eyes, Monty Don is in his borders replacing plants like wallflowers that are past their best with other annuals that will give colour right through to autumn. Meanwhile, Carol Klein will be answering a viewer's letter with advice on gardening to provide a habitat for wildlife.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: At Longmeadow, Monty Don reveals how the garden has changed over the last four weeks and gets to grips with a variety of jobs in the walled garden. Meanwhile, Carol Klein celebrates the hardy geranium and visits East Lambrook Manor, a beautiful garden that is host to a stunning array of this cottage garden stalwart.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Rachel de Thame gets a preview of the gardens in the Olympic Park and meets those who have battled the elements to make sure they are at the peak of perfection; Carol Klein discovers London's wild side, exploring a community garden in the centre of the city that provides a haven for both flora and fauna; Joe Swift makes an exclusive visit to the historic garden at 10 Downing Street.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don reveals what to plant for fragrance during summer before turning his attention to his herb garden, cutting back marjorman, rosemary and thyme to ensure abundance for the rest of the summer, and sharing tips on how to propagate culinary herbs. Meanwhile, Rachel de Thame seeks out intoxicating scents on a visit to RHS Harlow Carr.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As the garden reaches an abundance of growth in August, it's the pond, hedges, and edges of the garden which are the focus of attention. In the pond the growth of algae is at its height, so Monty recommends some plants which will eventually improve the quality of the water and help to prevent this unwelcome growth. He also gets going on cutting the hedges and mowing the garden.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Our gardens offer so much at this time of year - after all our work earlier in the year it is now rewarding us with beds full of blooms, vegetables and berries. However, there is still plenty to be getting on with to ensure the beauty continues right through to the autumn and Monty Don has plenty of timely gardening techniques to ensure the garden stays in tip top condition throughout the summer months.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don shows how to plan late summer colour in the flowerbed, shares viewers' tips on how to overcome the onslaught of slugs and snails, and demonstrates how to successfully re-seed bare patches in the lawn. Plus, Carol Klein is in Yorkshire in search of the harebell, one of her favourite wild flowers. She also visits an historic garden to appreciate the harebell's cultivated cousin, the campanula.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: By the end of August, some perennial plants will be setting seed and, for gardeners on a budget, this is the time to collect, store and sow them to stock gardens for free. Monty Don demystifies the process by showing which seeds to sow now, which to save for later and which ones respond better to a bit of time spent in the fridge.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: For many gardeners, the beginning of September is the start of a new gardening season and, with this in mind, Monty Don recommends vegetables to sow now for winter cropping. He also plants out the rose cuttings he took last year and takes more from another of his favourite roses.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: In the cottage garden, Monty is moving a rose which has outgrown its space and in the vegetable garden he gives advice on what to plant now for spring. He also finds out more about the mysterious world of earthworms and discovers why they are vital for the garden.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Adam Frost demonstrates how to build a rose arch, mulches his beds and plants a blackcurrant to train up a fence. Frances Tophill visits RHS Wisley in Surrey to witness the seasonal colour that heathers can provide in the winter months.

programme.title: My Dream Farm
programme.desc: Monty Don helps six different families realise their dream of returning to the land. They're all determined to leave the rat race behind and transform their lives. With over forty years' experience of farming, Monty Don is on hand to guide the novices through their first, tentative steps. The first episode features Dick and Pauline Beijen, who gave up their executive lifestyle and moved from Dick's native Holland to Devon.

programme.title: My Dream Farm
programme.desc: Having tires of their stressful city life, Rob and Sue Wood moved from the London suburbs to a windswept corner of Cornwall to pursue Rob's dream of living a more self-sufficient life. While renting a tiny smallholding costing them a whopping ¬£1,200 a month, they hope to earn their living from the land. However, if that wasn't challenge enough, Sue is heavily pregnant with two young children already to care for.

programme.title: My Dream Farm
programme.desc: Monty meets Karon and Simon, who have grand plans to rear rare-breed pigs in Suffolk.

programme.title: Monty Don's American Gardens
programme.desc: Monty travels from Missouri to Chicago and then across to New York and Philadelphia. He begins his journey in a prairie, the original American flowering wilderness. Much of the prairie has disappeared but he meets a couple who have revived the tradition and enjoy showing it to him in full bloom.

programme.title: Monty Don's American Gardens
programme.desc: Monty goes South to explore gardens of early independent America and learns how the history of this part of the country is still very much evident in the places and people he meets. He visits the famous garden where President Thomas Jefferson, one of America's founding fathers, enjoyed spending his time seeking out seeds and plants for his thousand foot vegetable garden.

programme.title: Monty Don's American Gardens
programme.desc: Monty explores the extraordinary scenery of the west coast of America. He begins his journey in Arizona where he learns about cacti and marvels at the sight of them in the desert and in private gardens where they have replaced traditional plants and lawns.

programme.title: Monty Don's Adriatic Gardens
programme.desc: Monty travels to Europe and explores the influence of the Venetians on gardening. To begin with, he explores Venice on one of the city's famous barges, stepping out to visit green spaces large and small that are often hidden from view behind high walls.

programme.title: Monty Don's Adriatic Gardens
programme.desc: Monty begins in the city of Trieste, close to Italy's border with Croatia, to visit a public garden first created by an obsessive royal plantsman more than 150 years ago, which is now being carefully restored. He then heads down the Adriatic coast through Croatia to pick up the trail that the Venetians followed, ending his journey on the beautiful island of Lopud, near Dubrovnik.

programme.title: Monty Don's Adriatic Gardens
programme.desc: Monty begins the last leg of his journey in Corfu, a Greek island with strong Venetian links, including olive trees planted by them that are still grown today. Here, Monty visits a spectacular garden made by an Englishman with Greek connections.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: Monty Don is asked to rescue two nightmare outside spaces. In Salisbury, newly engaged Glenn and Zoe want a brand new garden and most of all they are desperate to produce flowers for their wedding. Currently their steeply sloping garden is completely unusable.

programme.title: Captain's Log
programme.desc: Captain Jonathan Moss is fishing the South Carolina low country with Captain Stephen Flook Jr. The weather is cold and windy, but the plan remains the same, FULL SEND!

programme.title: Fly Shop Tour
programme.desc: With Montana in the rearview mirror the Flylords team crosses over into Idaho. In this leg of the trip they hit Blue-Ribbon trout waters with the folks from Henrys Fork Anglers and Silver Creek Outfitters. They also have a chance to sit down with the owners of these operations and hear what these shops and fly fishing mean to them. Before they hit the road to Utah the crew joins in on another conservation event at Payette Brewing Company.

programme.title: Fly Shop Tour
programme.desc: It‚Äôs the final leg of the Fly Shop Tour and what better way to end it than with a trip down to see the crew at Fly Fish Food. We learn the unique story of how owners Clark ‚ÄúCheech‚Äù Pierce & Curtis Fry started their shop and spend some time chasing hungry Cutthroat. Wrapping it all up the team puts on the final conservation event of the season with Fly Fish Food and Fish For Garbage, as well as spending some time behind the oars on the Green River with crew at Western Rivers Fly Shop.

programme.title: Bonefish & Tarpon Trust
programme.desc: Watch the video to learn more about bonefish and tarpon connectivity and the importance of conservation at local and regional levels.

programme.title: The WoodHaven Way
programme.desc: Jeff & Cole of Buckventures TV, are back in Oklahoma with one big goal‚Äîcatching up with the buck they call ‚ÄúThat 170.‚Äù With a cold front rolling in, they waste no time hanging stands and getting in position for the action. Jeff breaks out the WoodHaven Intimidator grunt call and sets the stage with a decoy, hoping to pull the giant into bow range.

programme.title: The WoodHaven Way
programme.desc: Colten Scroggins and the whole family return to the blind to see if they can call one of the other gobblers back in to their setup. A family that hunts together stays together!
Adam Hays is no stranger to world class bucks, but last year ittook patience and determination to harvest this Illinois giant with3 days left in the season!
Tarif Alkhatibs is new to Team200, but no stranger to killing someof the biggest free range whitetails in his home state of Texas ‚Äìincluding the state record typical!

programme.title: Huntstand Presents
programme.desc: Massive wildfires had consumed thousands of acres across the Bighorn Mountains and the neighboring foothills. Would the annual HuntStand pronghorn camp be a total bust, or would the crew be able to find a few animals beyond the smoke?

programme.title: HuntStand Presents
programme.desc: Will Cooper finally trades 3 years of tough times for triumph in his quest to tag an out-of-state buck with a bow.

programme.title: The Bearded Buck
programme.desc: With two out of the five tags filled, The Bearded Buck Crew is on a roll. With a day and a half left, J-Rod and Austin are feeling the pressure.

programme.title: Black Cloud
programme.desc: We‚Äôre headed to the Midwest for a December waterfowl grind. First stop: Kansas, chasing ducks with the crew from Dirty‚Äôs Outerwear. Then Cole Barthel jumps south to Oklahoma to squeeze in one more hunt before Christmas break.

programme.title: Black Cloud
programme.desc: Team Realtree travels back to Arkansas and joins Rusty Creasey to hunt late season ducks.

programme.title: Black Cloud
programme.desc: The Realtree Crew continues their action-packed waterfowl hunt in Canada as the guys try to pull a few snow geese into the decoys.

programme.title: Black Cloud
programme.desc: The Realtree Waterfowl crew heads to Arkansas to hunt mallards in the timber. Rusty Creasey hosts Tyler and Colton Jordan, and Cole Barthel for an epic duck hunt.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: The story of the game changing 350 Legend cartridge is documented at deer camps across the midwest with the Keefer Brothers in Kansas, Mark and Terry Drury in Missouri, Melissa Bachman in Nebraska and Team Winchester back in Missouri.

programme.title: Deer and Deer Hunting
programme.desc: Can the everyday landowner really manage their property well enough to hold and retain mature bucks year after year? From habitat improvements and food plots to pressure control and property layout, discover what truly influences a buck‚Äôs decision to stay‚Äîor stray.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Mark is wrapping up his Argentina hunt and heading to Entre Rios to track down the final two birds on his list: the Rock Pigeon and the Eared Dove. This area is home to over 10 million birds, making it a prime hunting ground. With flocks of pigeons and doves filling the skies, Mark is set for a fast-paced, action-packed finish to his hunt‚Äîa perfect end to an unforgettable adventure.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Mark Peterson continues his hunt in Mexico for a Mexican Texanus Whitetail. On day one, Mark connected with a great management buck, making this buck the first Mexican Texanus Whitetail with his rifle. As temperatures drop and bucks become more active each passing day, he eagerly anticipates an action-packed evening ahead.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: With over 20 years of service, retiring as a Senior Chief Machinery Technician, Steven served abord multiple Coast Guard cutters, led critical missions, protected our nation's leaders, and earned the Coast Guard Achievement Medal for his outstanding service. Beyond the uniform, Steven has has spent decades giving back - coaching youth sports, mentoring young athletes, and living the values of service, leadership, and integrity. Steven's dedication didn't end with retirement - and neither does our gratitude. We were honored to have Steven at Thumbtack Ranch and are even more grateful for his service.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: Every year, hunters from across the country flock to various parts of Texas to extend their hunting season. This year, our friends from Struttinbuck did just the same. Matt and Clede make the long drive to Del Rio to hunt South Texas bucks right on the Mexico border.

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: In this episode, we dive into how we are using our knowledge and experience to not only get some amazing hunting property, but to have other people pay for it. programme.title: Final Run
programme.desc: On a family trip, Glen "Lucky" Singer must stop a train from careening toward disaster when an engineer's mistake causes a glitch in the controls.

programme.title: The Deal
programme.desc: After losing her husband and daughter in a terrible fire, an American woman living in Spain investigates a dangerous mystery surrounding their deaths.

programme.title: Home Invasion
programme.desc: A botched robbery turns into a hostage crisis as a gang of armed criminals holds a woman and four children captive while police surround the house.

programme.title: The Throwaways
programme.desc: After a shrewd hacker is captured by the CIA, he agrees to work with them as long as he gets to pick the members of his ragtag team.

programme.title: Guarding Tess
programme.desc: A cantankerous, beloved former First Lady, whose husband died in office, uses her extraordinary intelligence in a battle of wills with her bodyguard.

programme.title: Don't Raise the Bridge, Lower the River
programme.desc: A daydreamer enlists the help of his British con artist friend to steal and sell the plans for a valuable new oil drill in this spy thriller spoof.

programme.title: Funny Girl
programme.desc: In this bittersweet, classic musical drama, the vibrant and beautiful young Fanny Brice (Barbra Streisand) starts out as a bit player on the New York City vaudeville stage, but works her way up to stardom on Broadway. Valued for her vocal and comedic talents by the renowned theater impresario Florenz Ziegfeld (Walter Pidgeon), Fanny thrives, but her relationship with her suave, imprisoned businessman husband, Nick Arnstein (Omar Sharif), is another story.

programme.title: The Harder They Fall
programme.desc: Broke and without work, newspaper reporter Eddie Willis (Humphrey Bogart) agrees to work for the corrupt boxing promoter Nick Benko (Rod Steiger) to help hype his new boxer, Toro Moreno (Mike Lane). While Toro is beastly in appearance, he has no actual boxing talent, and all his fights are fixed. When Toro gets a shot at the title against the brutal Buddy Brannen (Max Baer), Willis is faced with the tough decision of whether or not to tell Toro that his entire career is a sham.

programme.title: Mr. Deeds Goes to Town
programme.desc: Longfellow Deeds (Gary Cooper), a resident of small-town Vermont, leads a simple life until he inherits a vast fortune from a late uncle. Soon, unscrupulous lawyer John Cedar (Douglas Dumbrille) brings Deeds to New York City, where the unassuming heir is the object of much media attention. When wily reporter Babe Bennett (Jean Arthur) gains the trust and affection of Deeds, she uses her position to publish condescending articles about him -- but are her feelings for him really that shallow?

programme.title: The Taming of the Shrew
programme.desc: A rich merchant's beautiful daughter and her volatile older sister are courted by rival suitors in this rambunctious version of Shakespeare's comedy.

programme.title: The Notorious Landlady
programme.desc: After falling for his charming landlady, an American diplomat in London learns that she's suspected of murder and tries to help her clear her name.

programme.title: The Heroes of Telemark
programme.desc: In German-occupied Norway in 1942, a resistance group attempts to sabotage the Nazi's production of essential atomic bomb components.

programme.title: First Comes Courage
programme.desc: Beautiful Norwegian woman Nicole Larsen (Merle Oberon) is dedicated to the local resistance movement, and seduces Nazi officer Paul Dichter (Carl Esmond) in order to gain information that will help to defeat the Germans. Complicating matters for Nicole are both the difficulty of her loathsome undercover work and the appearance of an old flame, handsome English soldier Allan Lowell (Brian Aherne), who would like nothing more than to reunite with her.

programme.title: Three for the Show
programme.desc: Widowed by World War I, a Broadway star remarries her late husband's songwriting partner only to have the first one turn up very much alive.

programme.title: Eight Iron Men
programme.desc: In this psychological war drama, the nerves of eight men wear thin, as they are pinned down for 17 days under heavy bombardment during World War II.

programme.title: Hot Blood
programme.desc: A gypsy woman who lives by decamping with marriage settlements from wealthy men meets her match in the handsome younger brother of a gypsy king.

programme.title: Cat Ballou
programme.desc: A young schoolteacher turns into an outlaw to avenge her murdered father.

programme.title: You Can't Take It With You
programme.desc: Sweet-natured Alice Sycamore (Jean Arthur) falls for banker's son Tony Kirby (James Stewart). But when she invites her snooty prospective in-laws to dinner to give their blessing to the marriage, Alice's peculiar extended family -- including philosophical grandfather Martin Vanderhof (Lionel Barrymore), hapless fledgling ballerina sister Essie (Ann Miller) and fireworks enthusiast father, Paul (Samuel S. Hinds) -- might be too eccentric for the staid Kirbys.

programme.title: Ten Wanted Men
programme.desc: Rancher John Stewart (Randolph Scott) prefers to to resolve problems without falling back on violent solutions. However, fellow cattleman Wick Campbell (Richard Boone) isn't so peaceful, and he hires a team of armed mercenaries, led by ruthless Frank Scavo (Leo Gordon), to rid him of any possible competition. After narrowly surviving an attack from Scavo and his men, Stewart has little choice but to fight back in order to save both his ranch and his family, including nephew Howie (Skip Homeier).

programme.title: Man in the Saddle
programme.desc: A wounded rancher (Randolph Scott) hides with a schoolmarm (Ellen Drew) after his ex-girlfriend's husband (Alexander Knox) runs him out of town.

programme.title: Go West, Young Girl!
programme.desc: New England writer Netty (Karen Valentine) and cavalry widow Gilda (Sandra Will) team up to find Billy the Kid.

programme.title: Phantom Stagecoach
programme.desc: A dispute between stage lines ends with a steel-armored stagecoach.

programme.title: The Last Posse
programme.desc: To settle an old score, a father and his sons rob a cattle-swindling rancher, go into hiding, and soon find a posse of townsfolk after them.

programme.title: Buchanan Rides Alone
programme.desc: Journeying from Mexico back home to West Texas, mercenary Tom Buchanan (Randolph Scott) takes a break for the night in the border town of Agry. He soon discovers that almost every resident -- from the crooked sheriff (Barry Kelley) to the shifty-eyed innkeeper -- is a member of the prominent Agry family. When Buchanan defends Juan de la Vega (Manuel Rojas), a young man about to be lynched for shooting the town drunk, he himself is accused of murder and must struggle to escape town alive.

programme.title: The Wild Westerners
programme.desc: A U.S. marshal (James Philbrook) and his wife (Nancy Kovack) bring Union gold east through outlaws and Indians.

programme.title: The Longest Drive
programme.desc: After a decade apart, a pair of brothers reunites to find their long-lost sister, who was kidnapped as a child and is now living with a native tribe.

programme.title: The Desperados
programme.desc: A family of Confederate guerrillas continues to kill long after the Civil War has ended. One of the sons breaks with the family to make a new life.

programme.title: The Hawk of Wild River
programme.desc: The Durango Kid (Charles Starrett) has himself thrown in jail to trick an outlaw known as the Hawk (Clayton Moore) and bring him and his entire gang to justice.

programme.title: Utah Blaine
programme.desc: A gunfighter helps a ranch owner in his attempt to prevent a renegade crew from taking over the territory.

programme.title: Jack McCall, Desperado
programme.desc: A lone gunslinger, Jack McCall (George Montgomery), bursts into a saloon and shoots dead the legendary Wild Bill Hickok (Douglas Kennedy). Arrested and put on trial, McCall recounts a twisted tale that paints Hickok as anything but heroic, explaining how Hickok and McCall's cousin Bat (James Seay) took over McCall's family's plantation, killed his parents and even framed him for crimes he didn't commit. McCall's cold-blooded killing of Hickok was warranted. Or was it?

programme.title: Apache Territory
programme.desc: A drifter crossing the Arizona desert routs a band of marauding Apaches and rescues the young survivor of a massacre.

programme.title: Comanche Station
programme.desc: When solitary cowboy Jefferson Cody (Randolph Scott) hears tales of a white woman living as a captive of the Comanche tribe, he rides deep into the tribe's territory to exchange goods for her freedom. As Cody escorts the captive woman away, he learns that she is Nancy Lowe (Nancy Gates), and that there is a sizable reward offered by her husband for her return. Cody and Mrs. Lowe must brave ruthless bounty hunters greedy for the reward, as well as the now-warring Comanches, to make it to safety.

programme.title: Massacre Canyon
programme.desc: A cavalry officer and two of his men set out to make sure that a shipment of guns safely reaches its destination.

programme.title: Lust for Gold
programme.desc: During the 1870s, the ruthless Jacob Walz (Glenn Ford) becomes very wealthy after locating a legendary Arizona gold mine and securing sole ownership by murdering his partner. Walz then travels to Phoenix, where he catches the attention of a beautiful and crafty woman named Julia Thomas (Ida Lupino), who has learned of his exploits. Eventually, Walz falls in love with Julia, unaware that she's already married to Pete (Gig Young), who is eyeing his fortune.

programme.title: Masterson of Kansas
programme.desc: In the 1870s, Marshal Wyatt Earp (Bruce Cowling) calls upon Dodge City, Kan., Sheriff Bat Masterson (George Montgomery) to track down rancher Merrick (John Maxwell), who is accused of murder. But, thanks to some proof held by local Native American Chief Yellow Hawk (Jay Silverheels), Masterson realizes Merrick might be the victim of a frame-up. So, with the help of Earp and gunfighter Doc Holliday (James Griffith), Masterson sets out to find those who are really behind the killing.

programme.title: Decision at Sundown
programme.desc: Bart and sidekick Sam arrive in Sundown on the wedding day of town boss Tate Kimbrough, whom Bart blames for his wife's death years earlier.

programme.title: In the Good Old Summertime
programme.desc: A pair of feuding co-workers at a music shop in turn-of-the-century Chicago have no idea they are falling in love as anonymous romantic pen pals.

programme.title: Battle of the Bulge
programme.desc: A crack Nazi unit holds off the Allies during World War II.

programme.title: Meet Me in St. Louis
programme.desc: Judy Garland's 1944 musical dramatizes turn-of-the-century family life.

programme.title: Weekend at the Waldorf
programme.desc: The lives of guests and staff intertwine at a hotel over one weekend.

programme.title: The Man Who Came to Dinner
programme.desc: After an accident, a literary critic recovers at the home of the family he was visiting, but his unplanned stay turns their lives upside down.

programme.title: Room for One More
programme.desc: A couple raising three kids brings two orphaned children into their home.

programme.title: Boys Town
programme.desc: True story of Father Flanagan's fight to build a home for orphaned boys.

programme.title: San Antonio
programme.desc: A reformed rustler tracks down a band of cattle thieves.

programme.title: The Thin Man
programme.desc: Nick, Nora and their terrier somehow always seem to crack their case.

programme.title: Three Godfathers

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Art comes to the picturesque Midsomer village of Angel's Rise with the opening of a new Sculpture Park. But when its launch is marred by murder, DCI Barnaby and DS Nelson have to get creative to crack a case where art imitates death, and everything has a deeper meaning.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: The discovery of a Saint's bones at an archaeological dig causes a stir in the village of Midsomer Cicely. But when the leader of the dig is murdered, DCI Barnaby and DS Nelson soon realise that it's not only skeletons that have been long buried in the hallowed ground.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: The annual fair and the daredevil riders of the Wall of Death come to Midsomer village Whitcombe Mallet. When the owner of an equestrian centre is trampled by his horse DCI Barnaby and DS Nelson have to unravel a complex feud from the past, where nothing is what it seems...

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Peter and Caroline Cave are house-hunting in Midsomer Newton. Shortly before leaving their hotel they mention they haven't been able to find what they're looking for; "something old and derelict that they can do up." Anne Merrick tells them about Winyard, a tumbledown cottage in the woods, might be for sale. At the estate agents they are told the house is not yet available for viewing. Later that evening they find the house on their own. However, Caroline has read up on the cottage's haunted reputation and only reluctantly explores it with Peter. The next morning they are found strangled in their own car. DCI Barnaby starts the investigation with the help of PC Ben Jones and they come across the world of estate agents, identical twins, ghosts, piano wire, and more before another body turns up.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Villagers of Midsomer Barton are all set to celebrate Oak Apple Week, especially as the carnival queen event is set to return after an eight year absence. Yet the body of the mother of a deceased, one-time carnival queen, found in a stream, looks set to spoil things, as Barnaby and Jones find themselves digging up the past. From familiar faces, to drunken boasts and hidden obessions, it slowly becomes clear that the mother's daughter might be the key to solving the murder, when more deaths follow.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Wealthy, eccentric and obese aristocrat Freddy Butler drops dead, shortly after gathering all three of his wives at Haddington Hall to make an announcement. Although George Bullard is adamant his death is from natural causes, the case is far from simple when Freddy's solicitor is deliberately killed in a house fire shortly afterwards and Freddy's will goes missing. Barnaby and Jones find themselves investigating the extended Butler family, uncovering hidden secrets, illegitimate children and elusive treasure in the process.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Martin Barrett, a local council clerk living in Midsomer Worthy, is murdered during the night by shotgun, prompting Barnaby and Jones to find a motive for his murder. When they discover that Barrett was an expert blackmailer, his victims become prime suspects for his death - from a local pub landlord, a cleaner, a prominent member of the police board, to a former marine geologist. As they investigate, finding themselves drawn to the seaside, they slowly uncover deception, theft, attempted blackmail and hatred.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: In the village of Broughton, a ninety-year-old battle of the sexes has often occurred, with men trying to oppose an event that the women have managed to successfully hold without interruption, until it culminates with casualties on both sides - Mildred Danvers, an elderly woman who had returned on the day of a funeral and poisoned in her hotel room, and Rev. Anthony Gant, shot during a major event being held in the village green, in view of many. It soon becomes clear someone may have wished to kill both to cover up a dark truth, and soon Barnaby has to figure out who amongst the village wanted both dead, complicated further when Gant's curate is murdered next.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Villagers in Elverton-cum-Latterly are up in arms and divided, over the building of a supermarket. Things soon come to a head when independent environmental supervisor, Frank Hopkirk, is found stabbed to death at a Jubb's Timber Yard, the site of the new supermarket, by a pair of children. When Barnaby and Jones investigate to determine who wanted Hopkirk dead, they find out that he secretly came to the village under various aliases for sexual rendezvous with various women in fantasy role-playing scenarios, and that he had been making further investigations on the future development site and having doubts over claims it was contaminated. Either someone didn't like his investigations, or someone didn't like his sexual appetite, but either way, Barnaby finds himself investigating lies and more to uncover the truth.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Barnaby and DC Ben Jones (Jason Hughes) find themselves attempting to unravel the deaths of a choir tenor, and later a bird watcher, before more murders occur. The case is complicated by a rivalry between the Midsomer Worthy and Aston Wherry choirs, due to compete in an upcoming competition, and suspicions that an art scam is to be conducted, and soon Barnaby and Jones become concerned about a local woman, who they fear may become a victim herself. Particularly when it becomes clear the bird watcher had been photographing suspicious activity of late.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: A few months ago, Annie Woodrow was arrested, accused of murdering her friend, Frances Trevelyan, on the motive of wanting Frances' husband. Her time in court has come, but DCI Barnaby is certain she still is holding things back in regards to the murder, and decides to monitor the trial. Yet a chance remark by Frances' youngest daughter, and a meeting with an old friend and psychiatrist, makes him begin to doubt the evidence for her conviction. Soon he and DC Jones, awaiting news of his promotion to DS, find themselves reinvestigating the case, and it soon becomes clear that they may have missed details that could implicate another in the murder.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders

programme.title: Midsomer Murders

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Some of the residents of Midsomer Worthy are trying to prevent James Harrington from turning Setwale Woods into a housing estate. Led by a solicitor, Bernadette Sullivan, and a local farmer, Simon Bartlett, who also happen to be having an affair, they haven't had much success in court. When Bartlett's wife Victoria is found dead in the woods, Barnaby and Troy must first determine is if her murder is related to the planned development or something as yet unknown. The information provided by two inquisitive children, who see the investigation as a fascinating game, proves invaluable in solving the crime.

programme.title: Ice Road Truckers

programme.title: Ice Road Truckers
programme.desc: It's day 53 of the ice road season and only the toughest truckers remain on a road that's sent many people packing.

programme.title: Ice Road Truckers
programme.desc: Spring brings a rush of warm weather and the big melt begins. The road is nearly empty as only the toughest or craziest truckers remain.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: What do you do when you have a fugitive you not only want to find, but believe can be helped back onto the straight and narrow? If you're Mary Ellen you call you good friend Dog.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Today's hunt takes Dog far from the glittering hotels of Waikiki to the parts of Hawaii tourist rarely see, Oahu's ramshackle tent cities. The team searches for a woman who has lost almost everything, her home, her family and her spirit.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: This hunt is personal. Dog's good friend and fellow bondsman Chris is running out of time. He has only days to find his fugitive or risk losing his business. In his hunt Dog confronts duplicitous tipsters, vicious attack dogs, and hostile neighbors.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog and the team are back in Colorado hunting bounties. Today's fugitive has a long rap sheet and a reputation for packing heat. With nothing but an address and phone number, the team heads out on the hunt.

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog and the Chapman clan start their hunt today.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: There are few louder wake-up calls than coming-to in a jail cell with no idea how you got there. Add the media splashing the news of your arrest on every TV channel, and if your name is Lyssa Chapman you know you are in for a rough day.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Things are seldom what they seem in the world of bounty hunting and it is through this maze of illusions that Dog pursues his prey.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog is back in Colorado chasing a young man with a taste for trouble. He's fled to Texas but with his family's house on the line Dog is willing to try a risky strategy. He enlists the family in an elaborate hoax to lure the runner home.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog is sick as a dog, but he still must lead the hunt for a fugitive named James. James' girlfriend tries to cover for him, but Dog surprises James in his bedroom and leads him away in cuffs.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Beth buys Dog a shirt with an embroidered chicken that looks like a dragon, but Dog explains he only wears shirts with pictures of either Jesus or a Harley-Davidson. When it's time to go to work, the team goes after Necia.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: It's Christmas day, and Dog sets out to nab Raymond, who robs to support his ice habit, and give him a little Christmas gift - shiny new handcuffs. A passerby in Chinatown tells Dog that Raymond's asleep on a park bench.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog and Beth have their hands full when they go after their former housekeeper, Lisa, who's jumped bond. They know this case will be tricky because Lisa knows everyone in the family.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: The bounty-hunter adventures of Duane "Dog" Chapman and his Posse are chronicled in this one hour "Best Of" special, featuring superlative memorable moments from the previous seven seasons.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: A small town bondsmen is in over his head, his business on the line, when he makes a desperate plea for help. Dog agrees and launches a high stake hunt through the desolate and dangerous mountain landscape of western Colorado.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Once in Montrose, Dog discovers that the million dollar fugitive is not the young bondsman's only problem. His kind heart and inexperience have led him to bail out a bevy of bail jumpers.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: There's no rest for the righteous and nobody knows this better then the Dog. He is committed to saving his new friend's bail bonding business, and now must race against time to bring a rogues gallery to justice.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Can Dog complete his mission to clean-up this frontier town? With four outlaws still on the lam, Dog sets out to bring 'em in. As day turns into night and with the darkness and the danger mounting, an undaunted Dog and team plan late night hits.

programme.title: TV-G
programme.desc: Peter and Dr. Rae join the world‚Äôs largest fish‚Äîwhale sharks. In Mexico, Peter dives with researchers using telemetry and biologgers to track health and migrations. At the Georgia Aquarium, they observe and monitor two captive whale sharks up close.

programme.title: TV-G
programme.desc: Peter and Dr. Rae visit Churchill, Manitoba‚Äîthe polar bear capital‚Äîto meet North America‚Äôs largest carnivores. With climate change thinning sea ice, they join scientists using tags and drones to track hunting, migration, and ways to protect bears.

programme.title: TV-G
programme.desc: Dr. Rae and Peter celebrate women leading conservation: Peter helps Lauren Hinson with coatis at Brevard Zoo, flies with Orla O‚ÄôBrien to survey right whales; Dr. Rae teams with Rhodes, Reeves, and SeaWorld on whales, ocelots, and manatee rehab.

programme.title: TV-G
programme.desc: Dr. Rae and Peter dive into shark conservation: attacks are rare, but humans kill millions and over a third of species face extinction. Peter tags a bull shark off Florida; in a Bahamas sanctuary they monitor sharks, meet reef and nurse sharks.

programme.title: TV-G
programme.desc: From Central America to the Canadian border, we catch and release wildlife. In South Florida, Peter tags baby crocodiles at a nuclear plant. In Panama, Dr. Rae rescues and relocates a sloth. In the Great Lakes, Peter surveys lake sturgeon.

programme.title: TV-G
programme.desc: Join Dr. Rae and Peter to help save Belugas. At Georgia Aquarium, five belugas aid research guiding conservation. In Churchill, Manitoba, they meet curious pods, hear underwater calls, and champion protecting this pristine habitat.

programme.title: TV-G
programme.desc: Peter and Dr. Rae cross America‚Äôs endangered prairies. In Wyoming Native lands, Peter sees bison return. In Montana, Dr. Rae spotlights prairie dogs, prairie engineers. Along the SoCal border, she helps save burrowing owls with artificial burrows.

programme.title: TV-G
programme.desc: We spotlight conservation icons: In the Bahamas, Dr. Rae helps release a green sea turtle. Peter meets polar bears at Columbus Zoo to learn their plight. In Panama, Dr. Rae honors the harpy eagle. In Mexico, Peter studies whale shark tourism.

programme.desc: Since 1963, Wild Kingdom has fought for wildlife. See two U.S. comebacks: California condors‚ÄîPeter aids biologists; Dr. Rae visits an egg lab‚Äîand in Texas, Peter helps relocate an endangered antelope once extinct in the wild.

programme.title: Holy Marvels With Dennis Quaid
programme.desc: The quest for immortality has captivated and confounded people for thousands of years, from the healing powers of the Holy Grail used by Jesus at the Last Supper, to the elusive Fountain of Youth and the storied philosopher's stone.

programme.title: Holy Marvels With Dennis Quaid
programme.desc: Relics from the crucifixion of Jesus Christ have fascinated the faithful for 2000 years, from the wooden cross and iron nails, to the crown of thorns and Spear of Destiny; analyzing if these sacred artifacts still exist and where are they.

programme.title: Holy Marvels With Dennis Quaid
programme.desc: For millennia, there has been speculation about how the world will end, from the detailed account in the Book of Revelation, to the prophecies foretold by Nostradamus, and even the belief in devastation caused by a strange blue star; a look into if whether or not any of these predictions could come true.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In July 1997, a triple murder terrified residents in the nation's capital. In a Georgetown coffee shop, three employees were shot to death. Investigators could find no immediate suspects and no clear motive for the attack. Evidence at the crime scene pointed in many different directions. Was this a hate crime, a robbery gone wrong, or an act of cold-blooded vengeance against one of the victims?

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: Beginning in California in 1995, a serial killer targeted vulnerable women. At first charming and generous, he quickly became violent. He was brutal with his kills and quick in his getaways. Traveling across the country, he struck in Mississippi, Louisiana and Florida. The FBI and local police needed to stop this cross-country killer before more women fell victim to his insatiable rage.
